content:
Sure, here are some additional criteria and questions that can be included in the intake form for matching coaches and clients:


| Criteria | Description | Example Question |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Learning Style | The client’s preferred way of learning and processing information. This could include visual, auditory, or kinesthetic learning styles. | How do you prefer to learn and process information? |
| Interests and Hobbies | The client’s interests and hobbies outside of work. This could help to identify shared interests and potential areas for personal growth. | What are some of your interests and hobbies outside of work? |
| Motivations | The client’s underlying motivations for seeking coaching, such as career advancement, personal growth, or work-life balance. | What motivated you to seek coaching at this time? |
| Feedback and Support | The client’s preferences for feedback and support, such as the frequency and format of feedback, and the level of support needed. | How often do you like to receive feedback and in what format? |
| Values and Beliefs | The client’s core values and beliefs that shape their worldview and decision-making. | What are some of your core values and beliefs that guide your life and work? |
| Cultural Awareness | The client’s cultural background and awareness, and their preferences for coaching with a coach who shares or understands their culture. | How important is it for you to work with a coach who shares or understands your cultural background? |
| Personality Traits | The client’s personality traits and characteristics that may impact their coaching relationship, such as introversion or extroversion, or openness to new experiences. | What are some of your personality traits and characteristics that you think may impact your coaching relationship? |
| Emotional Intelligence | The client’s emotional intelligence and ability to recognize and manage their own emotions and those of others. | How do you typically manage your emotions in difficult situations? |
By including these additional criteria and questions in the intake form, coaching practices can gather more comprehensive information about the client and their preferences, needs, and motivations for coaching. This can help to ensure that the matching process is more personalized and that the client is paired with a coach who is a good fit based on a range of factors. Additionally, this information can be used by coaches to tailor their coaching approach and strategies to better meet the needs of the client.
